intro: Bryonia hispida, commonly known as the rough bryony, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cucurbitaceae. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in dry, rocky habitats. The plant has a distinctive appearance, with hairy stems and large, lobed leaves. Its flowers are yellow and occur in clusters, and it produces orange-red berries that are toxic to humans and animals. Bryonia hispida is known for its medicinal properties, though it is used with caution due to its toxic compounds.
